user_request: Write a villanelle about the inevitability of change.
final_poem:
In life's great river, we ride its constant flow and sway (A)  
The currents of change are ever present in our lives; they guide us onward as well-trodden paths fade away (a).   
Yet each dawn brings with it the promise that tomorrow holds new guise.    
Though time's hands may steer, yet we hold a steadfast play  
Within ourselves amidst transformation’s relentless spray; in this perpetual shift of tides (a)   
In life's great river, our course is ever constant flow and sway.    
Its banks erode beneath the weight that years impart on us day by nightly dome  
Each tick a step into realms unseen as we navigate through change’s articulate (a)   
In life's great river, ride its waves with resolve or fear to stay.    
Yet even rivers find paths anew; their course from past and future drawn free by hands of fate so frail  
May shape new courses not foreseen nor dreamed within our young hearts confined (a)   
The currents guide us, life’s inevitable way to sway.

rhyme_analysis.expected_scheme: ABA ABA ABA ABA ABA ABAA
